summary: Main menu wallpapers based on select photoshoots by ShannasLiva
descriptionHtml:
[center]These are custom main menu wallpapers featuring select photos for my [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73847/?]other file[/url].

The file includes a readme, but I'll mention the process here as well:
Choose your wallpaper according to the letter matching the refrence picture included in the file
(just so you don't have to go to the nexus every time you want to switch wallpapers)
Place the desired wallpaper dds file in "Skyrim\Data\textures\interface\objects"

All done!

[u]First time adding custom wallpaper?
[/u]It may be necessary to have a special logo.nif file. If you have already used a custom menu it is likely that the flat nif for the "wallpaper" to display on is already in your Skyrim. If not, I've provided a copy of said nif in the optional downloads. Unpack and stick the logo.nif in:Â Skyrim\Data\meshes\interface\logo

[b]As far as I've tested they all work fine (that is no unusual stretching, deformities, unwanted borders etc etc) but if you [i]do[/i] find issues with the photos please specify which ones in the discussion and I'll try to help fix it.

[u][b][size=4]Note About Game Brightness Setting[/size][/b]
[/u]I use Seasons of Skyrim enb, and this preset requires the game brightness to be set to the lowest possible. Because of this the main menu is also affected and the wallpaper appears darker than it should, sometimes adding a nice atmospheric look to it, sometimes (in darker shots) making things hard to see. If you do have Seasons of Skyrim and/or have your brightness down, darker shots may appear too dark or even unable to see. Please use the "Dark Fix" version of the file to adjust for this if you do have your brightness down very low for whatever reason.[/b][/center]
author: ShannasLiva
